en: Then answered Eliphaz the Temanite, and said,
hmr: Chun, Eliphaz Teman mi chun a dawn a, a hril tah a:

en: If one assay to commune with thee, wilt thou be grieved? But who can withhold himself from speaking?
hmr: “Miin inbiekpui tum ta sienla che, pawi tîng i ti? Amiruokchu, tu am thuhrilnaa inthawkin ama insûm thei a ta?

en: Behold, thou hast instructed many, And thou hast strengthened the weak hands.
hmr: Ngai ta, mi tamtak chu i lo inchûktir a, Kut hrât nawhai chu i lo sukhrât hlak a.

en: Thy words have upholden him that was falling, And thou hast made firm the feeble knees.
hmr: I thuhai chun mi tlu ding khawm chu a lo chelngir a; Khûp zawihai khawm chu i lo sukdet hlak kha.

en: But now it is come unto thee, and thou faintest; It toucheth thee, and thou art troubled.
hmr: Amiruokchu, tuhin i chungah a hung tlung veh a, i châu tah a; Nang a hung tâwk cheh a, sukbuoiin i um tah a.

en: Is not thy fear of God thy confidence, And the integrity of thy ways thy hope?
hmr: Pathien i ṭina chu i ringpui niin, I lampuia ringumna chu i beiseina ni lo am a nih?

en: Remember, I pray thee, who ever perished, being innocent? Or where were the upright cut off?
hmr: Tuhin ngaituo la, pawi tâwk hlek loin tu am an bohmang hlak a? Annawleh, mi tluonghai chu khâwlai am sât thlâk an ni hlak a?

en: According as I have seen, they that plow iniquity, And sow trouble, reap the same.
hmr: Ka lo hmu ta hlak ang chun, rîtlona tûtuhai le, Buoina thêtuhai chun, chu ma chu an sîk hlak.

en: By the breath of God they perish, And by the blast of his anger are they consumed.
hmr: Pathien thuokin an bohmang a; A lunginsenna imûtin an kâng- hmang hlak.

en: The roaring of the lion, and the voice of the fierce lion, And the teeth of the young lions, are broken.
hmr: Sakeibaknei inrûm ri le sakeibaknei hrâng râwl ri le, Sakeibaknei vânglai hahai chu sukthliekin a um a.

en: The old lion perisheth for lack of prey, And the whelps of the lioness are scattered abroad.
hmr: Sakeibaknei puitling khawm chu fâkding tlasamin a bohmang a, Sakeibakneipui têhai khawm chu an invâk dar tah a.

en: Now a thing was secretly brought to me, And mine ear received a whisper thereof.
hmr: “Tuhin ka kuomah inrûktein thu a hung a; Ka na chun chutaka biekrûkna chu a hriet a nih.

en: In thoughts from the visions of the night, When deep sleep falleth on men,
hmr: Îmu inhniktaka mi in re ṭhiep lai, Zâna thilhmulâwkna ka ngai tuo laiin,

en: Fear came upon me, and trembling, Which made all my bones to shake.
hmr: Ṭitna ka chungah a hung tlung a, inthinna leh; Chu chun ka ruhai po po chu a sukhnîng hlak.

en: Then a spirit passed before my face; The hair of my flesh stood up.
hmr: Ka hmai zâwna hin thlâ a fe thleng a; Ka hmulthi chu ân ding hlak.

en: It stood still, but I could not discern the appearance thereof; A form was before mine eyes: There was silence, and I heard a voice, saying,
hmr: A ngîr zing a, nisienlakhawm, a hmêlput dân chu ka hrietthiem nawh a; Chu thlâ chu ka mitthlahaia hin a um zing a: A hung rê ṭhiep a, chuongchun, râwl chu ka hriet tah a.

en: Shall mortal man be more just than God? Shall a man be more pure than his Maker?
hmr: ‘Mihriem thithei hi Pathien hmaah mi dik a ni ding am a nih? Mihriem chu a Siemtu hmaa chun mi inthieng a ni ding am a nih?

en: Behold, he putteth no trust in his servants; And his angels he chargeth with folly:
hmr: Ngai ta, a siehlawhai khawm chu a ring zo nawh a, A vântirkohai khawm chu invêt a ti a nih.

en: How much more them that dwell in houses of clay, Whose foundation is in the dust, Who are crushed before the moth!
hmr: Pil inhaia umhai lem lem chuh e; a va ring naw zuol âwm ngei, A lungphûm chu pilvuta innghat a nih a, Hângthim hmaa suksiet ni el hlakhai chu.

en: Betwixt morning and evening they are destroyed: They perish for ever without any regarding it.
hmr: Zîngtieng le zântieng inkâra suksiet an ni hlak a; Hriet zingna hrim um loin an bohmang hlak.

en: Is not their tent-cord plucked up within them? They die, and that without wisdom.
hmr: An puon in hrui an sûnga chu a ṭilthla chun, Varna hrim um loin an thi el an naw am a nih?’
